subject: Re: [junit] Parameterized Test Case example
msgSnippet: ... No, I understand the point of view. There are times, however, when it s nice to know that there are 3 things to fix, rather than somewhere between 1 and
messageBody:
Mike Clark wrote:

>
> On Nov 21, 2003, at 4:27 PM, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> >
> > ...and you don't mind that one failing test brings down the whole
> > suite?
>
> Why should I mind as long as the failing test is fixed immediately? As
> it is, one failing test brings down my whole build process anyway. I
> consider that a good thing.
>
> I'm not trying to be facetious. I'm really trying to learn something
> new in all of this.

No, I understand the point of view. There are times, however, when it's
nice to know that there are 3 things to fix, rather than "somewhere
between 1 and 58." The former is better, I think, for morale. :)
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
